de.tub.dima.scotty.core.windowFunction

Interface ReduceAggregateFunction<InputType>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AggregateFunction<InputType,InputType,InputType>, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    InvertibleReduceAggregateFunction<Input>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MaxWindowFunction, MinWindowFunction, SumAggregation, SumWindowFunction
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ReduceAggregateFunction<InputType>
extends AggregateFunction<InputType,InputType,InputType>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default InputType lift(InputType inputTuple)
      Transforms a tuple to a partial aggregate.
      default InputType lower(InputType aggregate)
      Transforms a partial aggregate to a final aggregate.

      • Methods inherited from interface de.tub.dima.scotty.core.windowFunction.AggregateFunction

        combine

    • Method Detail

      • lift

        default InputType lift(InputType inputTuple)
        Description copied from interface: AggregateFunction
        Transforms a tuple to a partial aggregate. For example, consider an average computation. If a tuple ⟨p,v⟩ contains its position p and a value v, the lift function will transform it to ⟨sum←v, count←1⟩, which is the partial aggregate of that one tuple.
        Specified by:
        lift in interface AggregateFunction<InputType,InputType,InputType>
        Parameters:
        inputTuple - input Tuple
        Returns:
        PartialAggregate

      • lower

        default InputType lower(InputType aggregate)
        Description copied from interface: AggregateFunction
        Transforms a partial aggregate to a final aggregate. In our example, the lower function computes the average from sum and count: ⟨sum, count⟩ 7→ sum/count.
        Specified by:
        lower in interface AggregateFunction<InputType,InputType,InputType>
        Returns:
        final Aggregate
